001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
008import java.util.Set;
009
010/**
011 * The Motor Safety feature acts as a watchdog timer for an individual motor. It operates by
012 * maintaining a timer that tracks how long it has been since the feed() method has been called for
013 * that actuator. Code in the Driver Station class initiates a comparison of these timers to the
014 * timeout values for any actuator with safety enabled every 5 received packets (100ms nominal).
015 *
016 * <p>The subclass should call feed() whenever the motor value is updated.
017 */
018public abstract class MotorSafety {
019  private static final double kDefaultSafetyExpiration = 0.1;
020
021  private double m_expiration = kDefaultSafetyExpiration;
022  private boolean m_enabled;
023  private double m_stopTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
024  private final Object m_thisMutex = new Object();
025  private static final Set<MotorSafety> m_instanceList = new LinkedHashSet<>();
026  private static final Object m_listMutex = new Object();
027
028  /** MotorSafety constructor. */
029  public MotorSafety() {
030    synchronized (m_listMutex) {
031      m_instanceList.add(this);
032      // TODO Threads
033    }
034  }
035
036  /**
037   * Feed the motor safety object.
038   *
039   * <p>Resets the timer on this object that is used to do the timeouts.
040   */
041  public void feed() {
042    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
043      m_stopTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp() + m_expiration;
044    }
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Set the expiration time for the corresponding motor safety object.
049   *
050   * @param expirationTime The timeout value in seconds.
051   */
052  public void setExpiration(double expirationTime) {
053    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
054      m_expiration = expirationTime;
055    }
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Retrieve the timeout value for the corresponding motor safety object.
060   *
061   * @return the timeout value in seconds.
062   */
063  public double getExpiration() {
064    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
065      return m_expiration;
066    }
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Determine of the motor is still operating or has timed out.
071   *
072   * @return a true value if the motor is still operating normally and hasn't timed out.
073   */
074  public boolean isAlive() {
075    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
076      return !m_enabled || m_stopTime > Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
077    }
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Check if this motor has exceeded its timeout. This method is called periodically to determine
082   * if this motor has exceeded its timeout value. If it has, the stop method is called, and the
083   * motor is shut down until its value is updated again.
084   */
085  public void check() {
086    boolean enabled;
087    double stopTime;
088
089    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
090      enabled = m_enabled;
091      stopTime = m_stopTime;
092    }
093
094    if (!enabled || RobotState.isDisabled() || RobotState.isTest()) {
095      return;
096    }
097
098    if (stopTime < Timer.getFPGATimestamp()) {
099      DriverStation.reportError(
100          getDescription()
101              + "... Output not updated often enough. See https://docs.wpilib.org/motorsafety for more information.",
102          false);
103
104      stopMotor();
105    }
106  }
107
108  /**
109   * Enable/disable motor safety for this device.
110   *
111   * <p>Turn on and off the motor safety option for this PWM object.
112   *
113   * @param enabled True if motor safety is enforced for this object
114   */
115  public void setSafetyEnabled(boolean enabled) {
116    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
117      m_enabled = enabled;
118    }
119  }
120
121  /**
122   * Return the state of the motor safety enabled flag.
123   *
124   * <p>Return if the motor safety is currently enabled for this device.
125   *
126   * @return True if motor safety is enforced for this device
127   */
128  public boolean isSafetyEnabled() {
129    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
130      return m_enabled;
131    }
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Check the motors to see if any have timed out.
136   *
137   * <p>This static method is called periodically to poll all the motors and stop any that have
138   * timed out.
139   */
140  public static void checkMotors() {
141    synchronized (m_listMutex) {
142      for (MotorSafety elem : m_instanceList) {
143        elem.check();
144      }
145    }
146  }
147
148  public abstract void stopMotor();
149
150  public abstract String getDescription();
151}
